Package com.heringer

Class Complex

java.lang.Object
com.heringer.Complex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Icomplex
public class Complex extends Object implements Icomplex
Represents a complex number with real and imaginary parts. Supports both rectangular and polar forms. Provides static and instance methods for arithmetic operations on complex numbers.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a complex number from a string.

  • Constructor Details

    • Complex

      public Complex()
      Default constructor. Initializes a complex number as 0 + 0i.

    • Complex

      public Complex(Number Re, Number Img, String mode)
      Constructs a complex number using specified mode.
      Parameters:
      Re - the real part or magnitude depending on the mode.
      Img - the imaginary part or angle depending on the mode.
      mode - "Pol" for polar form, anything else for rectangular.

    • Complex

      public Complex(Number Re, Number Img)
      Constructs a complex number in rectangular form.
      Parameters:
      Re - real part.
      Img - imaginary part.

    • Complex

      public Complex(String complex)
      Constructs a complex number from a string. Supports both rectangular (e.g., "3+4i") and polar (e.g., "5<60") formats.
      Parameters:
      complex - string representation of a complex number.

    • Div

      public static Complex Div(String... complex)
      Divides a sequence of complex numbers represented as strings. The division is performed in the order given: result = c1 / c2 / c3 / ...
      Parameters:
      complex - variable number of strings representing complex numbers.
      Returns:
      resulting Complex after division.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any complex number has a magnitude of zero.

    • Div

      public static Complex Div(Complex... complexNumbers)
      Divides a sequence of Complex numbers. The division is performed in the order given: result = c1 / c2 / c3 / ...
      Parameters:
      complexNumbers - variable number of Complex instances.
      Returns:
      resulting Complex after division.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any complex number has a magnitude of zero.

    • Prod

      public Complex Prod(Complex a)
      Multiplies the current Complex number with another Complex number. The multiplication is done using the polar representation.
      Specified by:
      Prod in interface Icomplex
      Parameters:
      a - The Complex number to multiply with the current Complex number.
      Returns:
      The current Complex number instance after multiplication.

    • Div

      public Complex Div(Complex a)
      Divides the current Complex number by another Complex number. Division is performed in polar form.
      Specified by:
      Div in interface Icomplex
      Parameters:
      a - The Complex number to divide by.
      Returns:
      The current Complex number instance after division.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - If dividing by a zero complex number.

    • riemannProjection

      public Complex riemannProjection()
      Applies the Riemann projection to the current complex number. This maps the complex number onto the Riemann sphere.
      Specified by:
      riemannProjection in interface Icomplex
      Returns:
      A new Complex object representing the projected value.

    • exp

      public Complex exp()
      Calculates the complex exponential of this number. That is, returns e^(a + bi) = e^a * (cos(b) + i*sin(b)).
      Returns:
      A new Complex representing e^(this).

    • log

      public Complex log()
      Returns the natural logarithm (ln) of this complex number. The branch cut lies along the negative real axis (standard branch).
      Returns:
      A new Complex representing ln(z)

    • log10

      public Complex log10()
      Computes the base-10 logarithm of this complex number.
      Returns:
      A new Complex representing log10(this)

    • pow

      public Complex pow(int n)
      Raises this complex number to the power of an integer exponent.
      Parameters:
      n - The integer exponent
      Returns:
      A new Complex representing this^n
